一.definition: one; single; a (article); as soon as; entire; whole; all; throughout; "one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1); also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

一一.definition: one by one; one after another

一下.definition: (after a verb) a bit; a little (indicating brief duration, or softening the tone, or suggesting giving sth a try); all at once; suddenly

一下子.definition: in a short while; all at once; all of a sudden

一不做，二不休.pinyin: yī bù zuò ， èr bù xiū
一不做，二不休.definition: lit. either don't do it, or don't rest (idiom); fig. if you do it at all, you may as well go the whole hog; in for a penny, in for a pound

一不小心.definition: to be a little bit careless; to have a moment of inattentiveness; accidentally

一世.definition: generation; period of 30 years; one's whole lifetime; lifelong; age; era; times; the whole world; the First (of numbered European kings)

一丘之貉.definition: jackals of the same tribe (idiom); fig. They are all just as bad as each other.

一中原則.definition: One-China principle, the official doctrine that Taiwan is a province of China

一之謂甚.definition: see 一之為甚|一之为甚[yi1 zhi1 wei2 shen4]

一乾二淨.definition: thoroughly (idiom); completely; one and all; very clean

一了百了.definition: (idiom) once the main problem is solved, all troubles are solved; death ends all one's troubles

一事無成.definition: (idiom) to have achieved nothing; to be a total failure; to get nowhere

一二.definition: one or two; a few; a little; just a bit

一二九運動.definition: December 9th Movement (1935), student-led demonstrations demanding that the Chinese government resist Japanese aggression

一二八事變.definition: Shanghai Incident of 28th January 1932, Chinese uprising against Japanese quarters of Shanghai

一五一十.definition: lit. count by fives and tens (idiom); to narrate systematically and in full detail

一些.definition: some; a few; a little; (following an adjective) slightly ...er

一人得道，雞犬升天.pinyin: yī rén dé dào ， jī quǎn shēng tiān
一人得道，雞犬升天.definition: lit. when a person attains enlightenment and immortality, even his chickens and dogs will ascend to heaven with him (idiom); fig. when somebody attains a position of power and influence, their relatives and friends also benefit

一介不取.definition: to not even take a penny (as a bribe)

一代不如一代.pinyin: yī dài bù rú yī dài
一代不如一代.definition: to be getting worse with each generation

一以貫之.definition: (idiom) (of a principle, purpose etc) consistently upheld; adhered to from beginning to end

一併.definition: to lump together; to treat along with all the others

一來二去.definition: gradually; little by little; in the course of time

一個.definition: a; an; one; the whole (afternoon, summer vacation etc)

一個中國政策.pinyin: yī gè zhōng guó zhèng cè

一個個.definition: a number of; each and every one; one by one; one after another

一個勁兒.definition: erhua variant of 一個勁|一个劲[yi1 ge4 jin4]

一個天南，一個地北.pinyin: yī gè tiān nán ， yī gè dì běi

一個將軍一個令.pinyin: yī gè jiāng jūn yī gè lìng
一個將軍一個令.definition: lit. one general, one order (idiom); fig. every boss has their own rules; everyone has their own way of doing things

一個巴掌拍不響.pinyin: yī gè bā zhǎng pāi bù xiǎng
一個巴掌拍不響.definition: lit. one palm alone cannot clap (proverb); fig. it takes two persons to start a dispute; it takes two to tango; it's difficult to achieve anything without support

一個接一個.definition: one by one; one after another

一個樣.definition: the same; of the same type

一個蘿蔔一個坑.pinyin: yī gè luó bó yī gè kēng
一個蘿蔔一個坑.definition: lit. every turnip to its hole (idiom); fig. each person has his own position; each to his own; horses for courses; every kettle has its lid

一個頭兩個大.pinyin: yī gè tóu liǎng gè dà
一個頭兩個大.definition: (coll.) to feel as though one's head could explode (Tw)

一傳十，十傳百.pinyin: yī chuán shí ， shí chuán bǎi
一傳十，十傳百.definition: (idiom) (of news etc) to spread like wildfire; to be disseminated far and wide

一元論.definition: monism, belief that the universe is made of a single substance

一刀兩斷.definition: (idiom) to make a clean break with; to have nothing more to do with

一刀切.definition: lit. to cut all at one stroke (idiom); to impose uniformity; one solution fits a diversity of problems; one size fits all

一分為二.definition: one divides into two; to be two-sided; there are two sides to everything; to see both sb's good points and shortcomings (idiom)

一分耕耘，一分收穫.pinyin: yī fēn gēng yún ， yī fēn shōu huò

一分錢一分貨.pinyin: yī fēn qián yī fēn huò
一分錢一分貨.definition: you get what you pay for

一分錢兩分貨.pinyin: yī fēn qián liǎng fēn huò

一切向錢看.definition: to put money above everything else

一切就緒.definition: everything in its place and ready (idiom)

一刻千金.definition: (idiom) time is gold; every minute is precious

一則以喜，一則以憂.pinyin: yī zé yǐ xǐ ， yī zé yǐ yōu
一則以喜，一則以憂.definition: (idiom) happy on the one hand, but worried on the other

一剎那.definition: a moment; an instant; in a flash

一勞永逸.definition: to get sth done once and for all

一千零一夜.definition: The Book of One Thousand and One Nights

一半天.definition: in a day or two; soon

一卡通.definition: the name of various contactless smart cards, notably Yikatong (mainly for public transport in Beijing) and iPASS (mainly for public transport in Taiwan)

一反常態.definition: complete change from the normal state (idiom); quite uncharacteristic; entirely outside the norm; out of character

一口.definition: readily; flatly (deny, admit and so on); a mouthful; a bite

一口吃不成胖子.pinyin: yī kǒu chī bù chéng pàng zi
一口吃不成胖子.definition: lit. you cannot get fat with only one mouthful (proverb); fig. any significant achievement requires time, effort and persistence

一口吃個胖子.pinyin: yī kǒu chī gè pàng zi
一口吃個胖子.definition: lit. to want to get fat with only one mouthful (proverb); fig. to try to achieve one's goal in the shortest time possible; to be impatient for success

一口咬定.definition: to arbitrarily assert; to allege; to stick to one's statement; to cling to one's view

一口氣.definition: one breath; in one breath; at a stretch

一口氣兒.definition: erhua variant of 一口氣|一口气[yi1 kou3 qi4]

一古腦兒.definition: variant of 一股腦兒|一股脑儿[yi1 gu3 nao3 r5]

一句.definition: a line of verse; a sentence

一吐為快.definition: to get sth off one's chest

一向.definition: a period of time in the recent past; (indicating a period of time up to the present) all along; the whole time

一周.definition: one week; all the way around; a whole cycle

一呼百應.definition: (idiom) (of a call) to elict an enthusiastic response; to receive extensive approval

一呼百諾.definition: one command brings a hundred responses (idiom); having hundreds of attendants at one's beck and call

一命嗚呼.definition: to die (idiom); to breathe one's last; to give up the ghost

一命歸天.definition: see 一命嗚呼|一命呜呼[yi1 ming4 wu1 hu1]

一命歸西.definition: see 一命嗚呼|一命呜呼[yi1 ming4 wu1 hu1]

一命歸陰.definition: see 一命嗚呼|一命呜呼[yi1 ming4 wu1 hu1]

一品.definition: superb; first-rate; (of officials in imperial times) the highest rank

一品鍋.definition: dish containing a variety of meats and vegetables arranged in a broth in a clay pot; chafing dish

一哄而起.definition: (of a group of people) to rush into action

一哭二鬧三上吊.pinyin: yī kū èr nào sān shàng diào
一哭二鬧三上吊.definition: lit. to cry, then shout, then threaten suicide (saying); fig. to make a terrible scene; to throw a tantrum

一唱三嘆.definition: see 一倡三歎|一倡三叹[yi1 chang4 san1 tan4]

一問三不知.definition: lit. to reply "don't know" whatever the question (idiom); fig. absolutely no idea of what's going on; complete ignorance

一回事.definition: one and the same (thing); one thing (as distinct from another)

一回生二回熟.pinyin: yī huí shēng èr huí shú
一回生二回熟.definition: unfamiliar at first, but well accustomed soon enough (idiom)

一回生兩回熟.pinyin: yī huí shēng liǎng huí shú
一回生兩回熟.definition: see 一回生二回熟[yi1 hui2 sheng1 er4 hui2 shu2]

一國兩制.definition: one country, two systems (PRC proposal regarding Hong Kong, Macau and Taiwan)

一團和氣.definition: (idiom) to keep on the right side of everyone (often at the expense of principle)

一團漆黑.definition: pitch-dark; (fig.) completely in the dark; totally ignorant of; (fig.) grim; beyond salvation

一塊.definition: a piece; a chunk; (fig.) (coll.) (typically preceded by a specifier such as 這|这[zhe4]) aspect; area; dimension (Example: 情感這一塊|情感这一块[qing2gan3 zhe4 yi1kuai4] "the emotional aspect (of it)"); (coll.) one yuan; a dollar; together; in the same place; in company

一塊兒.definition: erhua variant of 一塊|一块[yi1 kuai4]

一塌糊塗.definition: muddled and completely collapsing (idiom); in an awful condition; complete shambles; a total mess

一塵不染.definition: (idiom) untainted by even a speck of dust; spotlessly clean; (of a person) honest; incorruptible

一壁.definition: at the same time; simultaneously; while

一夔已足.definition: one talented person is enough for the job (idiom)

一夕數驚.definition: lit. one scare after another in a single night (idiom); fig. to live in fear

一大早.definition: at dawn; at first light; first thing in the morning

一大早兒.definition: erhua variant of 一大早[yi1 da4 zao3]

一天一個樣.definition: to change from day to day

一天到晚.definition: all day long; the whole day

一夫當關，萬夫莫開.pinyin: yī fū dāng guān ， wàn fū mò kāi
一夫當關，萬夫莫開.definition: (idiom) one man guarding the pass can prevent the passage of ten thousand

一失足成千古恨.pinyin: yī shī zú chéng qiān gǔ hèn
一失足成千古恨.definition: a single slip may cause everlasting sorrow (idiom)

一套.definition: suit; a set; a collection; of the same kind; the same old stuff; set pattern of behavior

一如既往.definition: (idiom) just as in the past; as before; continuing as always

一字.definition: in a row; in a line

一字不提.definition: to not mention a single word (about sth) (idiom)

一字不落.definition: see 一字不漏[yi1 zi4 bu4 lou4]

一字之師.definition: one who can correct a misread or misspelt character and thus be your master

一字兒.definition: in a row; in a line

一字千金.definition: one word worth a thousand in gold (idiom); (in praise of a piece of writing or calligraphy) each character is perfect; each word is highly valued

一字巾.definition: headband; strip of cloth worn around the head

一字褒貶.definition: lit. dispensing praise or blame with a single word (idiom); fig. concise and powerful style

一學就會.definition: to pick up (a skill) in a very short time; to take to sth like a duck to water

一定.definition: surely; certainly; necessarily; fixed; a certain (extent etc); given; particular; must

一家.definition: the whole family; the same family; the family ... (when preceded by a family name); group

一家之主.definition: master of the house; head of the family

一家人.definition: the whole family; members of the same family (lit. or fig.)

一家人不說兩家話.pinyin: yī jiā rén bù shuō liǎng jiā huà
一家人不說兩家話.definition: lit. family members speak frankly with one another, not courteously, as if they were from two different families (idiom); fig. people don't need to be deferential when they ask a family member for help; people from the same family should stick together (and good friends likewise)

一寸光陰一寸金.pinyin: yī cùn guāng yīn yī cùn jīn

一寸光陰一寸金，寸金難買寸光陰.pinyin: yī cùn guāng yīn yī cùn jīn ， cùn jīn nán mǎi cùn guāng yīn
一寸光陰一寸金，寸金難買寸光陰.definition: lit. an interval of time is worth an ounce of gold, money cannot buy you time (saying); fig. time is precious

一小部分.definition: a small part; a small section

一展身手.definition: to showcase one's talents; to display one's prowess

一山不容二虎.pinyin: yī shān bù róng èr hǔ
一山不容二虎.definition: lit. the mountain can't have two tigers (idiom); fig. this town ain't big enough for the two of us; (of two rivals) to be fiercely competitive

一帆風順.definition: propitious wind throughout the journey (idiom); plain sailing; to go smoothly; have a nice trip!

一席之地.definition: (acknowledged) place; a role to play; niche

一席話.definition: the content of a conversation; words; remarks

一帶一路.definition: Belt and Road Initiative, Chinese government plan to provide finance and engineering expertise to build infrastructure across Eurasia and northeast Africa, unveiled in 2013

一帶而過.definition: to skate around; to skip over; to skimp

一年之計在於春.pinyin: yī nián zhī jì zài yú chūn
一年之計在於春.definition: the whole year must be planned for in the spring (idiom); early planning is the key to success

一年期.definition: one year period (in a contract or budget)

一年被蛇咬，十年怕井繩.pinyin: yī nián bèi shé yǎo ， shí nián pà jǐng shéng
一年被蛇咬，十年怕井繩.definition: see 一朝被蛇咬，十年怕井繩|一朝被蛇咬，十年怕井绳 [yi1zhao1 bei4 she2 yao3 , shi2nian2 pa4 jing3sheng2]

一度.definition: for a time; at one time; one time; once

一彈指頃.definition: a snap of the fingers (idiom); in a flash; in the twinkling of an eye

一往無前.definition: to advance courageously (idiom); to press forward

一往直前.definition: see 一往無前|一往无前[yi1 wang3 wu2 qian2]

一律.definition: same; identical; uniformly; all; without exception

一心一德.definition: of one heart and one mind (idiom)

一心一意.definition: concentrating one's thoughts and efforts; single-minded; bent on; intently

一心二用.definition: to do two things at once (idiom); to multitask; to divide one's attention

一念之差.definition: momentary slip; false step; ill-considered action

一意孤行.definition: obstinately clinging to one's course (idiom); willful; one's own way; dogmatic

一成不變.definition: (idiom) immutable; impervious to change; set in stone

一房一廳.definition: one bedroom and one living room

一手.definition: a skill; mastery of a trade; by oneself; without outside help

一手交錢，一手交貨.pinyin: yī shǒu jiāo qián ， yī shǒu jiāo huò
一手交錢，一手交貨.definition: lit. one hand exchanges the cash, the other the goods (idiom); fig. to pay for what you want in cash; simple and direct transaction

一手包辦.definition: to take care of a matter all by oneself; to run the whole show

一手遮天.definition: lit. to hide the sky with one hand; to hide the truth from the masses

一技之長.definition: proficiency in a particular field (idiom); skill in a specialized area (idiom)

一把屎一把尿.pinyin: yī bǎ shǐ yī bǎ niào
一把屎一把尿.definition: to have endured all sorts of hardships (to raise one's children) (idiom)

一把年紀.definition: to be of an advanced age; to be old; an advanced age

一把手.definition: working hand; member of a work team; participant; the boss (short form of 第一把手[di4 yi1 ba3 shou3])

一把抓.definition: to attempt all tasks at once; to manage every detail regardless of its importance

一把眼淚一把鼻涕.pinyin: yī bǎ yǎn lèi yī bǎ bí tì
一把眼淚一把鼻涕.definition: with one's face covered in tears (idiom)

一把鑰匙開一把鎖.pinyin: yī bǎ yào shi kāi yī bǎ suǒ
一把鑰匙開一把鎖.definition: One key opens one lock.; There is a different solution for each problem. (idiom)

一抓一大把.definition: to be a dime a dozen; easy to come by

一拍兩散.definition: (idiom) (of marriage or business partners) to break up; to separate

一拍即合.definition: lit. to be together from the first beat (idiom); to hit it off; to click together; to chime in easily

一掃而光.definition: see 一掃而空|一扫而空[yi1sao3er2kong1]

一掃而空.definition: (idiom) to make a clean sweep of; to clean out

一推六二五.definition: 1 divided by 16 is 0.0625 (abacus rule); (fig.) to deny responsibility; to pass the buck

一掬同情之淚.pinyin: yī jū tóng qíng zhī lèi

一揮而就.definition: to finish (a letter, a painting) at a stroke

一擲千金.definition: lit. stake a thousand pieces of gold on one throw (idiom); to throw away money recklessly; extravagant

一改故轍.definition: complete change from the old rut (idiom); dramatic change of direction; a volte-face; to change old practices

一敗塗地.definition: lit. defeated, the ground blanketed with bodies (idiom); fig. to suffer a crushing defeat

一斑.definition: lit. one spot (on the leopard); fig. one small item in a big scheme

一方.definition: a party (in a contract or legal case); one side; area; region

一族.definition: social group; subculture; family; clan; see also 族[zu2]

一日三秋.definition: a single day apart seems like three seasons (idiom)

一日三餐.definition: to have three meals a day

一日不如一日.pinyin: yī rì bù rú yī rì
一日不如一日.definition: to be getting worse by the day

一日不見，如隔三秋.pinyin: yī rì bù jiàn ， rú gé sān qiū
一日不見，如隔三秋.definition: one day apart seems like three years (idiom)

一日之計在於晨.pinyin: yī rì zhī jì zài yú chén
一日之計在於晨.definition: make your day's plan early in the morning (idiom); early morning is the golden time of the day

一日之雅.definition: lit. friends for a day (idiom); fig. casual acquaintance

一日千里.definition: lit. one day, a thousand miles (idiom); rapid progress

一日為師，終身為父.pinyin: yī rì wèi shī ， zhōng shēn wèi fù
一日為師，終身為父.definition: (idiom) teacher for one day, father forever; students should have deep respect and lifelong gratitude for their teachers

一旦.definition: in case (sth happens); if; once (sth happens, then...); when; in a short time; in one day

一早.definition: early in the morning; at dawn

一星半點.definition: just the tiniest bit; a hint of

一是一，二是二.pinyin: yī shì yī ， èr shì èr
一是一，二是二.definition: lit. one is one, two is two (idiom); fig. things are (or ought to be) perfectly clear-cut; unequivocal

一時.definition: a period of time; a while; for a short while; temporary; momentary; at the same time

一時半刻.definition: (idiom) a short time; a little while

一時半晌.definition: a short time; a little while

一時半會.definition: a short time; a little while

一時半會兒.definition: a short time; a little while

一時半霎.definition: a short time; a little while

一時瑜亮.definition: two remarkable persons living at the same period (as 周瑜[Zhou1 Yu2] and 諸葛亮|诸葛亮[Zhu1 ge3 Liang4])

一晃.definition: (of passing time) in an instant; (of a sight) in a flash

一暴十寒.definition: one day's sun, ten days' frost (idiom, from Mencius); fig. to work for a bit then skimp; sporadic effort; short attention span

一曝十寒.definition: one day's sun, ten days' frost (idiom, from Mencius); fig. to work for a bit then skimp; sporadic effort; lack of sticking power; short attention span

一更.definition: first of the five night watch periods 19:00-21:00 (old)

一會.definition: a moment; a while; in a moment; also pr. [yi1 hui3]

一會兒.definition: a moment; a while; in a moment; now...now...; also pr. [yi1 hui3 r5]

一月.definition: January; first month (of the lunar year)

一望無垠.definition: to stretch as far as the eye can see (idiom)

一望無際.definition: as far as the eye can see (idiom)

一望而知.definition: (idiom) to be evident at a glance

一朝一夕.definition: lit. one morning and one evening (idiom); fig. in a short period of time; overnight

一朝天子一朝臣.pinyin: yī cháo tiān zǐ yī cháo chén
一朝天子一朝臣.definition: new emperor, new officials (idiom); a new chief brings in new aides

一朝被蛇咬，十年怕井繩.pinyin: yī zhāo bèi shé yǎo ， shí nián pà jǐng shéng
一朝被蛇咬，十年怕井繩.definition: lit. once bitten by a snake, one is scared all one's life at the mere sight of a rope (saying); fig. once bitten, twice shy

一木難支.definition: lit. a single post cannot prop up a falling house (idiom); fig. one is helpless alone

一本萬利.definition: small capital, huge profit (idiom); to put in a little and get a lot out

一杯羹.definition: lit. a cup of soup; fig. to get part of the profits; one's share of the action

一板一眼.definition: lit. one strong beat and one weak beats in a measure of music (two beats in the bar) (idiom); fig. follow a prescribed pattern to the letter; scrupulous attention to detail

一板三眼.definition: lit. one strong beat and three weak beats in a measure of music (four beats in the bar) (idiom); fig. scrupulous attention to detail

一枝獨秀.definition: lit. only one branch of the tree is thriving (idiom); fig. to be in a league of one's own; outstanding

一柱擎天.definition: lit. to support the sky as a single pillar (idiom); fig. to take a crucial responsibility upon one's shoulders

一根繩上的螞蚱.pinyin: yī gēn shéng shàng de mǎ zhà
一根繩上的螞蚱.definition: see 一條繩上的螞蚱|一条绳上的蚂蚱[yi1 tiao2 sheng2 shang4 de5 ma4 zha5]

一條心.definition: to be of one mind; to think or act alike

一條繩上的螞蚱.pinyin: yī tiáo shéng shàng de mǎ zhà
一條繩上的螞蚱.definition: lit. grasshoppers tied together with a piece of string (idiom); fig. people who are in it together for better or worse; people who will sink or swim together

一條路走到黑.pinyin: yī tiáo lù zǒu dào hēi
一條路走到黑.definition: lit. to follow one road until dark (idiom); fig. to stick to one's ways; to cling to one's course

一條道走到黑.pinyin: yī tiáo dào zǒu dào hēi
一條道走到黑.definition: to stick to one's ways; to cling to one's course

一條龍.definition: lit. one dragon; integrated chain; coordinated process

一棍子打死.definition: to deal a single fatal blow; (fig.) to totally repudiate sb because of a minor error

一槌定音.definition: variant of 一錘定音|一锤定音[yi1 chui2 ding4 yin1]

一槍命中.definition: to hit with the first shot

一樣.definition: same; like; equal to; the same as; just like

一次.definition: first; first time; once; (math.) linear (of degree one)

一次生，兩次熟.pinyin: yī cì shēng ， liǎng cì shú
一次生，兩次熟.definition: unfamiliar at first but you get used to it; strangers are first meeting, but soon friends; an acquired taste

一步一個腳印.pinyin: yī bù yī gè jiǎo yìn
一步一個腳印.definition: one step, one footprint (idiom); steady progress; reliable

一步一趨.definition: see 亦步亦趨|亦步亦趋[yi4 bu4 yi4 qu1]

一步到位.definition: to settle a matter in one go

一步登天.definition: reaching heaven in a single bound (idiom); (esp. with negative: don't expect) instant success

一毛不拔.definition: lit. unwilling to spare a single hair (idiom); fig. extremely stingy

一氣.definition: at one go; at a stretch; for a period of time; forming a gang

一氣之下.definition: in a fit of pique; in a fury

一氣呵成.definition: to do something at one go; to flow smoothly

一決雌雄.definition: to have a showdown; to fight for mastery; to compete for a championship

一波三折.definition: calligraphic flourish with many twists; fig. many twists and turns

一波未平，一波又起.pinyin: yī bō wèi píng ， yī bō yòu qǐ
一波未平，一波又起.definition: before the first wave subsides, a new wave rises (idiom); a new problem arises before the old is solved; many twists and turns to a story; one thing after another

一清二楚.definition: to be very clear about sth (idiom)

一清如水.definition: lit. as clear as water (idiom); fig. (of officials etc) honest and incorruptible

一溜煙.definition: like a wisp of smoke; (to disappear etc) in an instant

一潭死水.definition: a pool of stagnant water; stagnant or listless condition

一炮打響.definition: (idiom) to hit the jackpot with a single shot; to achieve success at one's first try

一炮而紅.definition: to win instant success (idiom); to become an instant hit

一無所有.definition: not having anything at all (idiom); utterly lacking; without two sticks to rub together

一無所獲.definition: to gain nothing; to end up empty-handed

一無所知.definition: (idiom) not knowing anything at all; completely ignorant

一無所長.definition: not having any special skill; without any qualifications

一無是處.definition: (idiom) not one good point; everything about it is wrong

一物降一物.definition: lit. one object bests another object; every item has a weakness (idiom); there is a rock to every scissor, a scissor to every paper, and a paper to every rock

一琴一鶴.definition: carrying very little luggage (idiom); honest and incorruptible (government officials)

一瓶子不響，半瓶子晃蕩.pinyin: yī píng zi bù xiǎng ， bàn píng zi huǎng dàng
一瓶子不響，半瓶子晃蕩.definition: lit. a full bottle makes no sound; a half-filled bottle sloshes (idiom); fig. empty vessels make the most noise

一生.definition: all one's life; throughout one's life

一生一世.definition: a whole lifetime (idiom); all my life

一甲.definition: 1st rank or top three candidates who passed the imperial examination (i.e. 狀元|状元[zhuang4 yuan2], 榜眼[bang3 yan3], and 探花[tan4 hua1], respectively)

一男半女.definition: (idiom) a son or daughter; a child

一畝三分地.definition: a piece of land of 1.3 mu 畝|亩[mu3]; (fig.) one's turf

一病不起.definition: to fall gravely ill, never to recover (idiom)

一發不可收拾.pinyin: yī fā bù kě shōu shí
一發不可收拾.definition: once it gets started there's no stopping it

一發而不可收.pinyin: yī fā ér bù kě shōu
一發而不可收.definition: to be impossible to stop once started

一盤散沙.definition: lit. like a sheet of loose sand; fig. unable to cooperate (idiom)

一目十行.definition: ten lines at a glance (idiom); to read very rapidly

一直.definition: straight (in a straight line); continuously; always; all the way through

一直以來.definition: in the past always; for a long time now; until now

一眼.definition: a glance; a quick look; a glimpse

一眼望去.definition: as far as the eye can see

一眼看穿.definition: to see through something at first glance (idiom)

一睹.definition: to look; to have a glimpse at; to observe (sth's splendor)

一瞬.definition: one instant; very short time; the twinkle of an eye

一矢中的.definition: to hit the target with a single shot; to say something spot on (idiom)

一知半解.definition: (idiom) to have a superficial knowledge of a subject; to know a smattering of sth

一石二鳥.definition: to kill two birds with one stone (idiom)

一碗水端平.definition: lit. to hold a bowl of water level (idiom); fig. to be impartial

一種.definition: one kind of; one type of

一窩蜂.definition: like a swarm of bees; in droves (used to describe people flocking to do sth)

一窮二白.definition: impoverished; backward both economically and culturally

一窺端倪.definition: to infer easily; to guess at a glance; to get a clue

一竅不通.definition: lit. doesn't (even) enter a single aperture (of one's head); I don't understand a word (idiom); it's all Greek to me

一笑了之.definition: to laugh away (instead of taking seriously)

一笑置之.definition: to dismiss with a laugh; to make light of

一筆不苟.definition: lit. not even one stroke is negligent (idiom); fig. to write characters (calligraphy) in which every stroke is placed perfectly

一筆勾銷.definition: to write off at one stroke

一筆帶過.definition: (idiom) to mention only very briefly; to skate over (a topic)

一筆抹殺.definition: to blot out at one stroke; to reject out of hand; to deny without a hearing

一筆抹煞.definition: variant of 一筆抹殺|一笔抹杀[yi1 bi3 mo3 sha1]

一箭之仇.definition: a wrong suffered (idiom); old grievance; previous defeat

一箭雙鵰.definition: lit. one arrow, two golden eagles (idiom); to kill two birds with one stone

一籌莫展.definition: to be unable to find a solution; to be at wits' end

一籮筐.definition: bucketloads of; in large quantities; extremely

一粒老鼠屎壞了一鍋粥.pinyin: yī lì lǎo shǔ shǐ huài le yī guō zhōu
一粒老鼠屎壞了一鍋粥.definition: lit. one pellet of rat feces spoiled the whole pot of congee (idiom); fig. one bad apple can spoil the whole bunch

一系列.definition: a series of; a string of

一級棒.definition: first-rate; excellent (loanword from Japanese 一番, ichiban)

一絲一毫.definition: one thread, one hair (idiom); a tiny bit; an iota

一絲不掛.definition: not wearing one thread (idiom); absolutely naked; without a stitch of clothing; in one's birthday suit

一絲不苟.definition: not one thread loose (idiom); strictly according to the rules; meticulous; not one hair out of place

一經.definition: as soon as; once (an action has been completed)

一網打盡.definition: lit. to catch everything in the one net (idiom); fig. to scoop up the whole lot; to capture them all in one go

一線之間.definition: a hair's breadth apart; a fine line; a fine distinction

一線之隔.definition: a fine line; a fine distinction

一線生機.definition: (idiom) a chance of survival; a fighting chance; a ray of hope

一而再，再而三.pinyin: yì ér zài ， zài ér sān

一聲.definition: first tone in Mandarin (high, level tone)

一股子.definition: a whiff of; a taint of; a thread of

一股腦.definition: all of it; lock, stock and barrel

一股腦兒.definition: erhua variant of 一股腦|一股脑[yi1 gu3 nao3]

一胎化.definition: practice of allowing only one child per family

一脈相承.definition: traceable to the same stock (idiom); of a common origin (of trends, ideas etc)

一致.definition: consistent; unanimous; in agreement; together; in unison

一致字.definition: (orthography) consistent words (e.g. "dean", "bean", and "lean", where "-ean" is pronounced the same in each case); consistent characters (e.g. 搖|摇[yao2], 遙|遥[yao2] and 謠|谣[yao2], which share a phonetic component that reliably indicates that the pronunciation of the character is yáo)

一致資源定址器.pinyin: yí zhì zī yuán dìng zhǐ qì
一致資源定址器.definition: uniform resource locator (URL), i.e. web address

一舉.definition: a move; an action; in one move; at a stroke; in one go

一舉一動.definition: (idiom) every movement; each and every move

一舉兩得.definition: one move, two gains (idiom); two birds with one stone

一舉成功.definition: success at one go; to succeed at the first attempt

一舉手一投足.pinyin: yī jǔ shǒu yī tóu zú
一舉手一投足.definition: every little move; every single movement

一般.definition: same; ordinary; so-so; common; general; generally; in general

一般貿易.definition: general trade (i.e. importing and export without processing)

一落千丈.definition: lit. to drop a thousand zhang in one fall (idiom); fig. (of business, popularity etc) to suffer a sudden, devastating decline; to take a dive

一葉知秋.definition: lit. the falling of one leaf heralds the coming of autumn (idiom); fig. a small sign can indicate a great trend; a straw in the wind

一葉障目.definition: lit. eyes obscured by a single leaf (idiom); fig. not seeing the wider picture; can't see the wood for the trees

一著不慎，滿盤皆輸.pinyin: yī zhù bù shèn ， mǎn pán jiē shū
一著不慎，滿盤皆輸.definition: One careless move and the whole game is lost. (idiom)

一號.definition: first day of the month; toilet; (slang) top (in a homosexual relationship)

一衣帶水.definition: (separated only by) a narrow strip of water

一見鍾情.definition: to fall in love at first sight (idiom)

一見高低.definition: lit. to fight it out with sb to see who is best (idiom); fig. to cross swords with; to lock horns

一視同仁.definition: to treat everyone equally favorably (idiom); not to discriminate between people

一親芳澤.definition: to get close to; to get on intimate terms with

一覺醒來.definition: to wake up from a sleep

一覽.definition: at a glance; (in book titles) overview

一覽無餘.definition: to cover all at one glance (idiom); a panoramic view

一覽眾山小.definition: (last line of the poem 望岳 by Tang poet Du Fu 杜甫[Du4 Fu3]) with one look I shall see all the smaller mountains down below (from the summit of Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1]); (fig.) awe-inspiring view from a very high place

一觸即潰.definition: to collapse on the first encounter; to give way at once

一觸即發.definition: could happen at any moment; on the verge

一言不合.definition: (idiom) to have a disagreement; to clash verbally

一言九鼎.definition: one word worth nine sacred tripods (idiom); words of enormous weight

一言以蔽之.definition: one word says it all (idiom, from Analects); to cut a long story short; in a nutshell

一言千金.definition: one word worth a thousand in gold (idiom); valuable advice; words of enormous weight

一言堂.definition: (sign hung in a shop) prices fixed – no bargaining (old); having things decided by the will of a single individual; autocratic rule; (contrasted with 群言堂[qun2 yan2 tang2])

一言抄百總.definition: to cut a long story short

一言既出，駟馬難追.pinyin: yī yán jì chū ， sì mǎ nán zhuī
一言既出，駟馬難追.definition: lit. once said, a team of horses cannot unsay it (idiom); a promise must be kept

一言為定.definition: (idiom) it's a deal; that's settled then

一言為重.definition: each word carries weight; a promise must be kept (idiom)

一言難盡.definition: hard to explain in a few words (idiom); complicated and not easy to express succinctly

一語中的.definition: (idiom) to hit the mark with a comment; to say sth spot on

一語成讖.definition: (idiom) to have one's words turn out to be (tragically) prophetic

一語破的.definition: see 一語中的|一语中的[yi1yu3-zhong4di4]

一語道破.definition: one word says it all (idiom); to hit the nail on the head; to be pithy and correct

一語雙關.definition: to make a pun; to have a double meaning; double entendre

一說.definition: an expression of opinion; according to some

一諾千金.definition: a promise worth one thousand in gold (idiom); a promise that must be kept

一貫.definition: consistent; constant; from start to finish; all along; persistent

一走了之.definition: to avoid a problem by walking away from it; to quit

一起.definition: (in) the same place; together; in company (with); altogether; in total; an instance of; a case of (murder, accident, dispute etc)

一路.definition: the whole journey; all the way; going the same way; going in the same direction; of the same kind

一路上.definition: along the way; the whole way; (fig.) the whole time

一路來.definition: all the way; all along; since the start

一路平安.definition: to have a pleasant journey; Bon voyage!

一路貨.definition: see 一路貨色|一路货色[yi1 lu4 huo4 se4]

一路貨色.definition: (idiom) (pejorative) as detestable as each other; birds of a feather; cut from the same cloth

一蹴即至.definition: lit. to get there in one step (idiom); fig. easily done

一蹴可幾.definition: to succeed at the first try (idiom); easy as pie; one can do it at once

一蹴而就.definition: to get there in one step (idiom); easily done; success at a stroke; to get results overnight

一蹴而得.definition: to get there in one step (idiom); easily done; success at a stroke; to get results overnight

一蹶不振.definition: one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse; ruined at a stroke; unable to recover after a minor hitch

一躍而起.definition: to jump up suddenly; to bound up; to rise up in one bound

一身.definition: whole body; from head to toe; single person; a suit of clothes

一身兩役.definition: one person taking on two tasks simultaneously

一較高下.definition: to compete against; to measure oneself against; to go head to head (see who is best)

一輪.definition: first round or stage (of a match, election, talks, planned policy etc)

一轉眼.definition: in the blink of an eye

一退六二五.definition: see 一推六二五[yi1 tui1 liu4er4wu3]

一通百通.definition: grasp this fundamental point and all the rest will follow (idiom)

一逞獸欲.definition: to give way to one's beastly lust

一連.definition: in a row; in succession; running

一連串.definition: a succession of; a series of

一遍.definition: one time (all the way through); once through

一遞一聲.definition: (of singers etc) one answering the other

一邊.definition: one side; either side; on the one hand; on the other hand; doing while

一邊倒.definition: to have the advantage overwhelmingly on one side; to support unconditionally

一部二十四史，不知從何說起.pinyin: yī bù èr shí sì shǐ ， bù zhī cóng hé shuō qǐ
一部二十四史，不知從何說起.definition: It's a long and intricate story, I hardly know where to start.

一醉方休.definition: to get thoroughly drunk (idiom); to get plastered

一針見血.definition: lit. to draw blood on the first prick (idiom); fig. to hit the nail on the head

一錘子買賣.definition: a one-off, short-sighted deal; a one-shot, all-out attempt

一錘定音.definition: lit. to fix the tone with a single hammer blow; fig. to make the final decision

一錢不值.definition: not worth a penny; utterly worthless

一錯再錯.definition: to repeat errors; to continue blundering; to make continuous mistakes

一鍋端.definition: see 連鍋端|连锅端[lian2 guo1 duan1]

一鍋粥.definition: (lit.) a pot of porridge; (fig.) a complete mess

一門心思.definition: to set one's heart on sth (idiom)

一閃而過.definition: to flash past; to flit by

一陣.definition: a burst; a fit; a peal; a spell (period of time)

一陣子.definition: a while; a spell; a short time; a burst

一雨成秋.definition: a sudden shower towards the end of summer brings an abrupt arrival of autumn (idiom)

一面.definition: one side; one aspect; simultaneously... (and...); one's whole face

一面之交.definition: to have met once; casual acquaintance

一面之詞.definition: one side of the story; one-sided statement

一面倒.definition: to be entirely on one side; one-sided; lopsided; partisan; overwhelmingly on one side

一頭.definition: one head; a head full of sth; one end (of a stick); one side; headlong; directly; rapidly; simultaneously

一頭栽進.definition: to plunge into; to run headlong into

一頭熱.definition: one-sided enthusiasm (abbr. for 剃頭挑子一頭熱|剃头挑子一头热[ti4 tou2 tiao1 zi5 yi1 tou2 re4])

一頭霧水.definition: to be confused; to be baffled

一顆老鼠屎壞了一鍋湯.pinyin: yī kē lǎo shǔ shǐ huài le yī guō tāng
一顆老鼠屎壞了一鍋湯.definition: lit. one pellet of rat feces spoiled the whole pot of soup (idiom); fig. one bad apple can spoil the whole bunch

一顆老鼠屎壞了一鍋粥.pinyin: yī kē lǎo shǔ shǐ huài le yī guō zhōu
一顆老鼠屎壞了一鍋粥.definition: see 一粒老鼠屎壞了一鍋粥|一粒老鼠屎坏了一锅粥[yi1 li4 lao3 shu3 shi3 huai4 le5 yi1 guo1 zhou1]

一類保護動物.pinyin: yī lèi bǎo hù dòng wù

一飲而盡.definition: to drain the cup in one gulp (idiom)

一馬勺壞一鍋.pinyin: yī mǎ sháo huài yī guō
一馬勺壞一鍋.definition: one ladle (of sth bad) spoils the (whole) pot (idiom); one bad apple spoils the barrel

一馬平川.definition: flat land one could gallop straight across (idiom); wide expanse of flat country

一騎絕塵.definition: (idiom) to lead the pack by a wide margin; to leave one's competitors trailing behind in one's dust

一骨碌.definition: with a rolling or twisting movement; in a single movement; in one breath

一體.definition: an integral whole; all concerned; everybody

一體兩面.definition: (fig.) two sides of the same coin

一鬨而散.definition: see 一哄而散[yi1 hong1 er2 san4]

一鱗半爪.definition: lit. one scale and half a claw (idiom); fig. only odd bits and pieces

一鳴驚人.definition: to amaze the world with a single brilliant feat (idiom); an overnight celebrity

一點.definition: a bit; a little bit; (used in negative expressions) (not) the least bit; (after an adjective, used to form the comparative) a bit more, -er; a point (in a discussion etc); (calligraphy) dot stroke (、); one o'clock (abbr. for 一點鍾|一点钟[yi1 dian3zhong1])

一點一滴.definition: bit by bit; every little bit

一點一點.definition: little by little; bit by bit; gradually

一點兒.definition: erhua variant of 一點|一点[yi1 dian3]

一點就通.definition: a hint is all that is needed; understanding each other without the need to explain

一點水一個泡.pinyin: yī diǎn shuǐ yī gè pào

一鼻孔出氣.definition: lit. to breathe through the same nostril (idiom); fig. two people say exactly the same thing (usually derog.); to sing from the same hymn sheet
